citations.narrative:
The applicant is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). Twenty-Nine
dogs are not up to date on their rabies vaccinations, a required vaccination. The current Program of Veterinary Care
prescribes for the rabies vaccine to be given at 12 weeks of age, then one year of age, and then thereafter according to
the vaccine label directions (The applicant uses both 1 year and 3 year Rabies vaccines). The following dogs have no
history of receiving a rabies vaccination:
• Adult female Aussie Doodle (#8009)
• Adult female Aussie Doodle (#2305)
• Adult female Aussie Doodle (#0887)
• Adult female Aussie Doodle (#3623)
• Adult female Aussie Doodle (#0168)
• Adult female Bernedoodle (#5011)
• Adult female Bernedoodle (#5028)
• Adult female Bernedoodle (#5027)
• Adult female Bernedoodle (#5014)
• Adult female Bichon (#3244)
• Adult female Cavapoo (#1308)
• Adult male Cavalier King Charles Spaniel (#2999)
• Adult female Cockapoo (#0428)
• Adult female Cockapoo (#0430)
• Adult female Goldendoodle (#9028)
• Adult female Goldendoodle (#6875)
• Adult female Sheepadoodle (#5160)
• Adult female Sheepadoodle (#5154)
• Adult female Sheepadoodle (#0148)
• Adult female Poodle (#7940)
• Adult male Poodle (#8018)
• Adult male Poodle (#0890)
• Adult male Poodle (#4115)
• Adult male Poodle (#0889)
• Adult male Poodle (#2437)
• Adult male Poodle (#4161)
• Adult male Poodle (#5067)
• Adult male Poodle (#5079)
• Adult male Poodle (#4289)
Failure to administer required vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule leaves the dogs susceptible to
rabies, which is a life-threatening disease, and, if contracted, may cause pain, distress, and suffering. Correct by ensuring
all animals are vaccinated in accordance with the guidelines and schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian and
the vaccine manufacturer.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by October 12, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The applicant is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). Twenty-Nine 
dogs are not up to date on their rabies vaccinations, a required vaccination. The current Program of Veterinary Care 
prescribes for the rabies vaccine to be given at 12 weeks of age, then one year of age, and then thereafter according to 
the vaccine label directions (The applicant uses both 1 year and 3 year Rabies vaccines). The following dogs have no 
history of receiving a rabies vaccination: 
 
• Adult female Aussie Doodle (#8009) 
• Adult female Aussie Doodle (#2305) 
• Adult female Aussie Doodle (#0887) 
• Adult female Aussie Doodle (#3623) 
• Adult female Aussie Doodle (#0168) 
• Adult female Bernedoodle (#5011) 
• Adult female Bernedoodle (#5028) 
• Adult female Bernedoodle (#5027) 
• Adult female Bernedoodle (#5014) 
• Adult female Bichon (#3244) 
• Adult female Cavapoo (#1308) 
• Adult male Cavalier King Charles Spaniel (#2999) 
• Adult female Cockapoo (#0428) 
• Adult female Cockapoo (#0430) 
• Adult female Goldendoodle (#9028) 
• Adult female Goldendoodle (#6875) 
• Adult female Sheepadoodle (#5160) 
• Adult female Sheepadoodle (#5154) 
• Adult female Sheepadoodle (#0148) 
• Adult female Poodle (#7940) 
• Adult male Poodle (#8018) 
• Adult male Poodle (#0890) 
• Adult male Poodle (#4115)

• Adult male Poodle (#0889) 
• Adult male Poodle (#2437) 
• Adult male Poodle (#4161) 
• Adult male Poodle (#5067) 
• Adult male Poodle (#5079) 
• Adult male Poodle (#4289) 
 
Failure to administer required vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule leaves the dogs susceptible to 
rabies, which is a life-threatening disease, and, if contracted, may cause pain, distress, and suffering. Correct by ensuring 
all animals are vaccinated in accordance with the guidelines and schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian and 
the vaccine manufacturer. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by October 12, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
